verses.verse: God <S%H430><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> Noah, <S%H5146><s%> all the animals, <S%H2416><s%> and all the livestock <S%H929><s%> that were with him in the ship; <S%H8392><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> made <S%H5674><s%> a wind <S%H7307><s%> to pass <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%> The waters <S%H4325><s%> subsided. <S%H7918><s%>

The deep <S%H8415><s%>'s fountains <S%H4599><s%> and the sky <S%H8064><s%>'s windows <S%H699><s%> were also stopped, <S%H5534><s%> and the rain <S%H1653><s%> from the sky <S%H8064><s%> was restrained. <S%H3607><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> receded <S%H7725><s%> from the earth <S%H776><s%> continually. <S%H1980><s%> After the end <S%H7097><s%> of one hundred <S%H3967><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> decreased. <S%H2637><s%>

The ship <S%H8392><s%> rested <S%H5117><s%> in the seventh <S%H7637><s%> month, <S%H2320><s%> on the seventeenth <S%H6240><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> of the month, <S%H2320><s%> on Ararat <S%H780><s%>'s mountains. <S%H2022><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> receded continually <S%H1980><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the tenth <S%H6224><s%> month. <S%H2320><s%> In the tenth <S%H6224><s%> month, <S%H259><s%> on the first day of the month, <S%H2320><s%> the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> were seen. <S%H7200><s%>

It happened at the end <S%H7093><s%> of forty <S%H705><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> that Noah <S%H5146><s%> opened <S%H6605><s%> the window <S%H2474><s%> of the ship <S%H8392><s%> which he had made, <S%H6213><s%>

and he sent out <S%H7971><s%> a raven. <S%H6158><s%> It went <S%H3318><s%> back <S%H3318><s%> and forth, <S%H7725><s%> until the waters <S%H4325><s%> were dried up <S%H3001><s%> from the earth. <S%H776><s%>
He sent out <S%H7971><s%> a dove <S%H3123><s%> from him, <S%H7200><s%> to see if the waters <S%H4325><s%> were abated <S%H7043><s%> from the surface of the ground, <S%H127><s%>

but the dove <S%H3123><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> no place to rest <S%H4494><s%> her <S%H3709><s%> foot, <S%H7272><s%> and she returned <S%H7725><s%> to him into the ship; <S%H8392><s%> for the waters <S%H4325><s%> were on the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the whole earth. <S%H776><s%> He put out <S%H7971><s%> his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and took her, <S%H3947><s%> and brought her to him into the ship. <S%H8392><s%>
He stayed <S%H2342><s%> yet another <S%H312><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days; <S%H3117><s%> and again <S%H3254><s%> he sent the dove <S%H3123><s%> out <S%H7971><s%> of the ship. <S%H8392><s%>

The dove <S%H3123><s%> came back <S%H935><s%> to him at evening, <S%H6256><s%> and, <S%H6310><s%> behold, in her mouth was an olive <S%H2132><s%> leaf <S%H5929><s%> plucked off. <S%H2965><s%> So Noah <S%H5146><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that the waters <S%H4325><s%> were abated <S%H7043><s%> from the earth. <S%H776><s%>

He stayed <S%H3176><s%> yet another seven <S%H7651><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> and sent out <S%H7971><s%> the dove; <S%H3123><s%> and she didn't <S%H3254><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> to him any more. <S%H5750><s%>

It happened in the six <S%H8337><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> first year, <S%H8141><s%> in the first <S%H7223><s%> month, <S%H259><s%> the first day of the month, <S%H2320><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> were dried up <S%H2717><s%> from the earth. <S%H776><s%> Noah <S%H5146><s%> removed <S%H5493><s%> the covering <S%H4372><s%> of the ship, <S%H8392><s%> and looked. <S%H7200><s%> He saw that the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the ground <S%H127><s%> was dried. <S%H2717><s%>
In the second <S%H8145><s%> month, <S%H2320><s%> on the <S%H7651><s%> twenty-seventh <S%H6242><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> of the month, <S%H2320><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> was dry. <S%H3001><s%>
God <S%H430><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Noah, <S%H5146><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>
"Go out <S%H3318><s%> of the ship, <S%H8392><s%> you, <S%H802><s%> and your wife, and your sons, <S%H1121><s%> and your sons <S%H1121><s%>' wives with you. <S%H802><s%>

Bring out <S%H3318><s%> with you every living thing <S%H2416><s%> that is with you of all flesh, <S%H1320><s%> including birds, <S%H5775><s%> livestock, <S%H929><s%> and every creeping thing <S%H7431><s%> that creeps <S%H7430><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> that they may breed abundantly <S%H8317><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%> and be fruitful, <S%H6509><s%> and multiply <S%H7235><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>"
Noah <S%H5146><s%> went out, <S%H1121><s%> with his sons, his wife, <S%H802><s%> and his sons <S%H1121><s%>' wives with him. <S%H802><s%>

Every animal, <S%H2416><s%> every creeping thing, <S%H7431><s%> and every bird, <S%H5775><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> moves <S%H7430><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> after their families, <S%H4940><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> of the ship. <S%H8392><s%>

Noah <S%H5146><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> of every clean <S%H2889><s%> animal, <S%H929><s%> and of every clean <S%H2889><s%> bird, <S%H5775><s%> and offered <S%H5927><s%> burnt offerings <S%H5930><s%> on the altar. <S%H4196><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> smelled <S%H7306><s%> the pleasant <S%H5207><s%> aroma. <S%H7381><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> in <S%H413><s%> his heart, <S%H3820><s%> "I will not again <S%H3254><s%> curse <S%H7043><s%> the ground <S%H127><s%> any more for man <S%H120><s%>'s sake, <S%H5668><s%> because the imagination <S%H3336><s%> of man <S%H120><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> is evil <S%H7451><s%> from his youth; <S%H5271><s%> neither will I ever again <S%H3254><s%> strike <S%H5221><s%> everything living, <S%H2416><s%> as I have done. <S%H6213><s%>

While the earth <S%H776><s%> remains, <S%H3117><s%> seed <S%H2233><s%> time and harvest, <S%H7105><s%> and cold <S%H7120><s%> and heat, <S%H2527><s%> and summer <S%H7019><s%> and winter, <S%H2779><s%> and day <S%H3117><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> shall not cease. <S%H7673><s%>"
